divs: Sighting DetailsThe photo was taken some time ago. me and at least 2 friends where out looking to take photos of the incoming lightning storm. We went to a vantage point overlooking Glasgow. I had tacken several shoots this day. It was only yesterday that I was going over the photos I have on my hard drive to delete and edit through what I have. "this was to clear up space and to prep my portfolio" On finding these shots I put the image in to photoshop as I wanted to get a clearer look at the image on the left hand side in the clouds. I can say there is no way it could be an known aircraft.1st thing is the size, Then the faint out line. the order of the lights are not what I am awaire of as standard confirurations. It had me more than a little shocked at what I think I maywell be seeing. In PS I was doing colour correction contrast changes to see if it would make the image any clearer. It does show a little better. the 2 photos I have attached are both without any edit what so ever. As this was a find long after the photo what taken I cant say what it was doing or anything about the motion of it. If I had seen it I would have got much beter shoots of it.
Summary: Very Long at least 5 lights on exterior
trends: There have been 28 other sightings in Glasgow
There were no other sightings in Glasgow on or around August 1st 2009
This sighting has never been favorited.
